intro: Pectinaria thouarsii, commonly known as the Madagascar pectinaria, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and restricted habitat, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
